features: MORE POWER: Classic Steam Iron comes equipped with 1200 Watts of power for quick heating
POWERFUL SHOT OF STEAM FEATURE: works horizontally or vertically for hanging garments, upholstery, or drapery
SPRAY MIST FEATURE: the spray mist feature helps smooth out even the toughest wrinkles
NON-STICK SOLEPLATE: mid-size nonstick soleplate glides smoothly across fabrics
AUTO-SHUT OFF: equipped with a 30 minute auto-off feature for added safety and peace of mind
EASY TO MANEUVER: the 8-foot 360° swivel cord allows for freedom of movement while ironing
NO LEAKS, NO WORRY: water tank 170ml equipped with an Anti-Drip system for mess-free ironing,
ACCURATE PRECISION: precision tip gets in between buttons, lapels and around collars when using iron for clothes
body.description: Sunbeam Classic 1200W Steam Iron is efficient and easy to use. The Shot of Steam feature provides an extra burst of steam to help smooth out stubborn wrinkles on both flat surfaces and vertically on hanging garments. The anti-drip system prevents water leakage to eliminate unwanted drips. The Classic Steam Iron offers 5 fabric settings and 3 steam select settings. The durable non-stick soleplate surface glides over fabrics and smoothes out wrinkles quickly and efficiently. Featuring a 3-way motion smart auto-off automatically shuts the iron off if left unattended or set in an improper position.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good basic iron for the casual ironer!
reviews.reviewText: This does everything I need an iron to do at a good price.It stays hot. It's smooth. If I need more steam, the burst of steam works great. It's very lightweight and easy to use. There's no cord storage that I can find, but this is a minor inconvenience for me.People who iron a lot may want a bigger water tank or other features. But if you're like me and don't iron a lot of things at one time, this does the trick.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One Word-Perfect (for me)
reviews.reviewText: Believe it or not, the cord “can” wrap around the bottom of the iron. There is a little space and if you are slow and align the cord around, it is out of the way. Now, there is no way to keep it there, but, I found a way that works for me. I used a hair rubberband and put it over the plug and just twist it once and pulled the other end over the top end of the iron (the point). It is perfect now. The cord doesn’t fly everywhere. Oh, the iron—great purchase, light weight, functions well. If it is good for an hotel chain… it’s good enough! I do not iron a lot. It also can be used as a quick steamer. I always thought an iron had to be heavy to be good…and, this has convinced me otherwise.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Light weight and easy to use temp control. Does not hold much water for steam ironing, but does a great job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Iron with Steam feature
reviews.reviewText: This Iron is just what I was looking for. Good burst of steam when you need it and it was also a great price. Not heavy and easy to use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars As Good as I Remember
reviews.reviewText: When I was in college, I purchased my first Sunbeam iron for $20. It lasted for seven years and did a beautiful job getting wrinkles out of clothing and pressing fabric for sewing. After it wore out, I used an older Rowenta my husband had and was never very satisfied with it. It leaked a lot more, didn't get as hot, and the mister eventually broke in it. When it wore out completely, I purchased this iron and have been delighted with it for over a year. It is the same quality as my old one, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable and reliable iron.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A good replacement
reviews.reviewText: This is the closest iron I could find to my last one that lasted me 10 years. I originally purchased my old iron for keeping shirts neat but it has served me well through many years of garment sewing and quilting. When it finally died after an electrical surge I wanted to get the same thing, and I did. This one has a good weight (not too heavy, not too light), versatile steam functions, and important safety features (since I do sometimes forget to turn it off). Hopefully this one lasts another 10 years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Well, lasted 3 years
reviews.reviewText: I usually only post reviews if I have something specific to say, but if I had read a review that said it only lasted 3 years I probably wouldn't have bought it. Use it for pressing seams when I'm quilting, sits on the same table all the time. I don't know that I've ever dropped it or banged it around at all. Plugged it in today and it just won't get hot. Light doesn't come on. 3 years of light use.
Very good so far. Lots of steam. Good for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Que lo que se comparta sea de gran VALOR para el que recibe.
reviews.reviewText: Que lo que se comparta sea de gran VALOR para el que recibe.

I have not been ironing anything for years and only have an old, 40 year old, heavy. clunky iron. Now I ordered a few T-shirts, tops and boleros that have chiffon or are entirely chiffon, so they need ironing to fall properrly. This one works like crazy, the steam function is amazing and in minutes the work is done.Very happy with purchase and highly recommend it.
Nos ha resultado muy funcional y duradero

This Sunbeam steam iron is in overall pretty good. I love the titanium plate and it glides so easy on my fabric. When not in use in the upright position, it stays on for 30 minutes which is a great bonus for me, most of them it is only 8 minutes and as I do a lot of small project, I could be at the sewing machine for more than 8 minutes and when I need the iron, I need it to be on. So far my only complaint is that even in the off position, the light still blinks on and off which I believe keeps the handle a touch warm from the light. I am not sure if this is suppose to be like this, anyone who has an answer for me on this, would be much appreciated.
